title: Andres Calderon
text: My research focuses on Data Science, Big Data, Data Mining, and Visualization, with a particular emphasis on spatial and spatio-temporal components. I am deeply passionate about exploring new concepts and sharing knowledge with others.

title: Andres Calderon
text:
Education

title: Andres Calderon
text:
Experience

title: Projects
text:
Predicting House Prices with Machine Learning



Python


Machine Learning


Data Cleaning



This project involves using machine learning algorithms to predict house prices based on various features such as location, size, and amenities. It includes data cleaning, feature engineering, and model selection.



Jan 1, 2024














Customer Segmentation Using Clustering Techniques



R


Machine Learning


Clustering


Statistical Modelling



This project focuses on segmenting customers into different groups based on their purchasing behavior and demographics. It uses clustering algorithms like K-means and hierarchical clustering to identify distinct customer segments.



Apr 1, 2024














Visualizing Global CO2 Emissions



R


Data Visualization


Environmental Science



This project involves creating visualizations to show trends in global CO2 emissions over time. It includes data extraction from public databases, data cleaning, and using visualization libraries to create interactive charts and graphs.



Jul 1, 2024

title: Third Blog Post
text:
The source for any page in your website could also be a Jupyter Notebook. This one is third-post/index.ipynb.
Here’s an example I borrowed from the Seaborn docs:

import seaborn as sns

sns.set_theme(style="whitegrid")

# Load the diamonds dataset
diamonds = sns.load_dataset("diamonds")

# Plot the distribution of clarity ratings, conditional on carat
sns.displot(
    data=diamonds,
    x="carat", hue="cut",
    kind="kde", height=4, aspect=1.5,
    multiple="fill", clip=(0, None),
    palette="ch:rot=-.25,hue=1,light=.75",   
)

title: Academic Background
text:
Ph.D. (C) Computer Science - 2024 University of California, Riverside, CA • Ph.D. research in big spatial data under direction of prof. Vassilis Tsotras (thesis: Scalable Spatial Operations and Pattern Detection Using Distributed Systems).
M.Sc. Geo-Information Science and Earth Observation - 2011 University of Twente, Enschede, the Netherlands • Focus areas: Geo-informatics and Spatial Data Mining (thesis: Mining moving flock patterns in large spatio-temporal datasets using a frequent pattern mining approach).
Systems Engineering - 2007 Universidad de Nariño, Pasto, Colombia • Focus areas: Databases and Data Mining (thesis: TariyKDD: A data mining tool loosely coupled with a DBMS).

title: Andres Calderon
text: My research focuses on Data Science, Big Data, Data Mining, and Visualization, with a particular emphasis on spatial and spatio-temporal components. I am deeply passionate about exploring new concepts and sharing knowledge with others.

title: Employment History
text:
Teacher Assistant / Graduate Researcher Student (2015 - 2024). University of California, Data Science Center, Riverside, CA.

Conducting research in big spatial data, with a focus on distributed geometric data structures and parallel algorithms for detecting movement patterns.
Teaching Assistant for courses in Data Structures, Data Mining, Embedded Systems, and Introduction to Programming.

Research Coordinator (2023). Universidad de los Andes, Bogota, Colombia.

Assist in selecting the optimal study area for establishing a proof-of-concept prototype of a solar and biomass explorer.
Provide support in designing and implementing a proof-of-concept solar satellite explorer within the chosen area.
Aid in developing a proof-of-concept satellite explorer focused on agricultural applications in the selected area.
Assist in creating an integrated system that combines the satellite explorers developed for agricultural and solar applications across Colombia.
Provid guidance on collecting metadata and downloading satellite images cov- ering the entire Colombian territory.
Develop a comprehensive map of Colombia using the collected satellite images.
Advise on implementing an AI model for identifying palm oil coverage nation- wide.
Support the design and deployment of a web application to host the proof-of- concept for the biomass atlas.

Assistant Researcher (2014 - 2015). Universidad de Nariño, Departamento de Ingenierı́a Electrónica, Pasto, Colombia.

Researcher at GeoAlternar project. Geo-reference of alternative energy sources (solar, wind and biomass) in the Department of Nariño, Colombia.
Management of remote sensing imagery to support the collection and processing of Landsat and Sentinel satellite images.
Analysis and processing of geospatial data using machine learning techniques in order to identify locations with high resources potential.
Design and implementation of GeoAlternar web portal to explore solar, wind and biomass potential in the department of Nariño, Colombia.

Assistant Researcher (2011 - 2014). Universidad de Nariño, Departamento de Ingenierı́a de Sistemas, Pasto, Colombi.a

Researcher at SIGEODEP project. Mapping crime and injury events in the municipality of Pasto, Nariño.
Design and implementation of a web mapping application to geo-reference and visualize data about crime and injuries in the city of Pasto, Colombia.
Design and implementation of a datamart to aggregate and analyze available data.
Design and implementation of a data mining tool to support the discovery of patterns and trends in the data processed by the datamart.

Assistant Professor (2011 - 2015). Universidad de Nariño, Departamento de Ingenierı́a de Sistemas, Pasto, Colombia.

Elective courses in Geographic Information Systems and Databases.

Lecturer (2008). Universidad de Nariño, Departamento de Ingenierı́a de Sistemas, Pasto, Colombia.

Elective course in Databases I and III.

Member Technical Staff (2006 - 2008). ParqueSoft Pasto, Pasto, Colombia.

Software development and technical support.
Entrepreneur committee member by democratic election.
Leader of the Knowledge Management Strategy.
Member of the board.

title: Academic Background
text:
Ph.D. Computer Science (2024). University of California, Riverside, CA.

Focus areas: Big spatial data, distributed spatial data structures and parallel algorithms for movement patterns discovery.
Thesis: Scaling Spatial Overlay Operations and Flock Pattern Discovery (under supervision of Prof. Vassilis Tsotras.

M.Sc. Geo-Information Science and Earth Observation (2011). University of Twente, Enschede, the Netherlands.

Focus areas: Geo-informatics and Spatial Data Mining.
Thesis: Mining moving flock patterns in large spatio-temporal datasets using a frequent pattern mining approach.

Systems Engineering (2007). Universidad de Nariño, Pasto, Colombia.

Focus areas: Databases and Data Mining
Thesis: TariyKDD: A data mining tool loosely coupled with a DBMS.

title: Special Achievements
text:
UCR / CS Department Outstanding Teacher Assistant Award 2018, University of California - Riverside, Department of Computer Science and Engineering. November, 2018.
Fulbright-Minciencias Scholarshipfor PhD studies abroad. Comision Fulbright and Ministerio de Ciencia, Tecnologia e Innovacion. September, 2015.
UTwente / ITC Faculty Graduation Prize 2011for best MSc Thesis. University of Twente, ITC Faculty. September, 2011.
Beca Colfuturo, for MSc studies abroad. Fundacion para el futuro de Colombia (COLFUTURO). July 2009.

title: Publications
text:
[1] L. Abdelhafeez, A. O. Calderon Romero, A. Magdy, and V. J. Tsotras, ‘Pyneapple-G: Scalable Spatial Grouping Queries’, Proc. VLDB Endow., vol. 17, no. 12, pp. 4469–4472, Nov. 2024. doi: 10.14778/3685800.3685902.
[2] A. O. Calderon Romero, V. J. Tsotras, and A. Magdy, ‘Scalable Overlay Operations over DCEL Polygon Layers’, in Proceedings of the 18th International Symposium on Spatial and Temporal Data, in SSTD ’23. New York, NY, USA: Association for Computing Machinery, Agosto 2023, pp. 85–95. doi: 10.1145/3609956.3609964.
[3] O. E. Cabrera Rosero and A. O. Calderon Romero, ‘FP-Flock: An algorithm to find frequent flock patterns in spatio-temporal databases’, presented at the IV Simposio Argentino de GRANdes DAtos (AGRANDA 2018) - JAIIO 47 (CABA, 2018), Sep. 2018. ISSN: 2451-7569
[4] R. Timarán-Pereira, A. O. Calderon Romero, and A. Hidalgo-Troya, ‘Application of decision trees in the identification of patterns of fatal injuries by external cause in the municipality of Pasto, Colombia’, Universidad y Salud, vol. 19, no. 3, pp. 388–399, Dec. 2017. doi: 10.22267/rus.171903.101.
[5] O. Cabrera, B. Champutiz, A. O. Calderon Romero, and A. Pantoja, ‘Landsat and MODIS satellite image processing for solar irradiance estimation in the department of Narino-Colombia’, in 2016 XXI Symposium on Signal Processing, Images and Artificial Vision (STSIVA), Aug. 2016, pp. 1–6. doi: 10.1109/STSIVA.2016.7743306.
[6] U. Turdukulov, A. O. Calderon Romero, O. Huisman, and V. Retsios, ‘Visual mining of moving flock patterns in large spatio-temporal data sets using a frequent pattern approach’, International Journal of Geographical Information Science, vol. 28, no. 10, pp. 2013–2029, Oct. 2014, doi: 10.1080/13658816.2014.889834.
[7] O. E. Cabrera Rosero and A. O. Calderon Romero, ‘Performance analysis of flock pattern algorithms in spatio-temporal databases’, in 2014 XL Latin American Computing Conference (CLEI), Sep. 2014, pp. 1–6. doi: 10.1109/CLEI.2014.6965180.
[8] R. T. Pereira, A. O. Calderon Romero, and J. J. Toledo, ‘Extraction Student Dropout Patterns with Data Mining Techniques in Undergraduate Programs’, presented at the International Conference on Knowledge Discovery and Information Retrieval, SCITEPRESS, Sep. 2013, pp. 136–142. doi: 10.5220/0004543001360142.
[9] R. T. Pereira, A. O. Calderon Romero, and J. J. Toledo, ‘Descubrimiento de perfiles de deserción estudiantil con técnicas de minería de datos’, Revista Vínculos, vol. 10, no. 1, Art. no. 1, Jun. 2013. doi: 10.14483/2322939X.4687.
[10] R. T. Pereira, A. O. Calderon Romero, and J. J. Toledo, ‘Aplicación de la minería de datos en la extracción de perfiles de deserción estudiantil [Application of data mining in extracting student dropout profiles]’, Ventana Informática, no. 28, Art. no. 28, Jun. 2013. doi: 10.30554/ventanainform.28.181.2013.
[11] R. T. Pereira, A. O. Calderon Romero, M. C. Yepez Chamorro, ‘La minería de datos como un método innovador para la detección de patrones de deserción estudiantil en programas de pregrado en instituciones de educación superior’, EIEI ACOFI, Aug. 2013. doi: 10.26507/ponencia.1516.
[12] R. Timarán Pereira, M. C. Yepez Chamorro, and A. O. Calderon Romero, ‘Detecting Survival Patterns in Women with Invasive Cervical Cancer with Decision Trees’, in Advances in Artificial Intelligence – IBERAMIA 2012, J. Pavón, N. D. Duque-Méndez, and R. Fuentes-Fernández, Eds., Berlin, Heidelberg: Springer, 2012, pp. 130–139. doi: 10.1007/978-3-642-34654-5_14.
[13] R. T. Pereira, A. O. Calderon Romero, and J. J. Toledo, ‘Detección de Patrones de Deserción Estudiantil con Minería de Datos Caso de Estudio: Universidad de Nariño e Institución Universitaria CESMAG’ | Editorial Universidad de Nariño’. ISBN: 979-958-8958-38-5

On submission:
[14] H. Núñez, A. O. Calderon Romero, N. Díaz, R. Sierra, and D. Vásquez, ‘Potencial de la inteligencia artificial en teledetección para el desarrollo sostenible y la gestión ambiental’. Available at .
[15] A. O. Calderon Romero, P. Balakov, M. Vieira, and V. J. Tsotras, ‘Scalable Processing of Moving Flock Patterns’. Available at .
[16] A. O. Calderon Romero, L. Abdelhafeez, G. Trajcevski, A. Magdy, and V. J. Tsotras, ‘On Scalable DCEL Overlay Operations’. Available at .
